description: Contractual workers of Hindustan Construction Company stage a protest against the non-payment of their wages for the past five months at the site of Bogibeel bridge in Dibrugarh district on Wednesday.
title: Workers protest
text:
Contractual workers of Hindustan Construction Company stage a protest against the non-payment of their wages for the past five months at the site of Bogibeel bridge in Dibrugarh district on Wednesday.
'We have not received wages from the company for the past five months,'' said one of the protesters.
Construction work was stopped for the day because of the protest by 5,000 labourers.
'The company has not provided any basic amenities for us but has exploited us many times,'' alleged Sonjay Das, a worker under the company.
An official of the company promised the protesters that their dues would be cleared withing four days.
Hindustan Construction Company heads a three-company joint venture for girder (or superstructure) work. It has completed laying 10 spans of girder across the country.
The firm, which constructed the Bandra-Worli Sea Link in Mumbai, has a 51 per cent share in the joint venture worth Rs 987 crore.
Former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee had inaugurated the construction of Bogibeel bridge on April 21, 2002, at Chowkidinghee playground in Dibrugarh, 17km from the construction site.
The Bogibeel bridge, the longest rail-cum-road bridge in the country, which will be built over the Brahmaputra, is expected to be ready by June 2017. Text by Avik Chakraborty, picture by UB Photos
